translation_keys.example: The experts obsessed with eliminating your busywork

structure.name: Alex Thompson
structure.bio: Former McKinsey consultant who built his first business automation at 22. Obsessed with turning manual processes into self-running systems. When not architecting automations, you'll find him reading sci-fi or tinkering with AI agents.

structure.name: Sarah Chen
structure.bio: Full-stack engineer with a decade of experience building enterprise software. Specializes in scalable architectures and turning complex requirements into elegant code. Passionate about mentorship and open-source contributions.

structure.name: Marcus Rodriguez
structure.bio: Spent 8 years in operations before discovering his calling in automation. Expert at identifying bottlenecks and designing workflows that save hundreds of hours. Believes every repetitive task is an opportunity waiting to be automated.

structure.name: Priya Patel
structure.bio: Background in project management and customer success across SaaS and consulting. Ensures clients don't just get software—they get measurable outcomes. Known for turning skeptical stakeholders into automation advocates.

notes: Structure supports 4-6 members - add up to 2 more objects following same pattern
Photos are optional - component will show initials if photo path is empty or null

aria_considerations: Section should have aria-labelledby pointing to section title

If using placeholder initials, container should have aria-label describing the person

Cards are non-interactive (not clickable as a whole), so no role='button' needed

photos.alt_text: Required - descriptive alt text for each photo

initials_generation.description: Auto-generate initials from member name if not provided in data
initials_generation.code_example: const getInitials = (name: string): string => { const names = name.trim().split(' '); return (names[0]?.[0] || '') + (names[names.length - 1]?.[0] || ''); }; const initials = member.initials || getInitials(member.name);
initials_generation.edge_cases: Handle single-word names (use first two letters) and empty names (fallback to '?')
